sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Members of the UN General Assembly vote to reject Russia's annexation of four Ukrainian territories that it partially occupies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Kiev says it's captured more settlements near Kherson in the south, while residents of newly liberated eastern areas remain without key services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The EU agrees to start joint gas purchases before next summer, as President Putin blames the energy crisis on the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Members of the UN General Assembly have voted overwhelmingly to condemn Russia's annexation of four Ukrainian regions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's the strongest show of support yet for Ukraine from the UN body, calling on Russia to reverse its actions. 143 countries voted for the measure, with only five against amid 35 abstentions. A UN member state, one with a permanent seat on the Security Council, has attempted to annex territory from its neighbor by force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This UN member state has not only put its neighbor in its crosshairs, but also put a bull's eye in this institution's core principle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: One country cannot take the territory of another by force despite a major US diplomatic effort to bolster support for the motion 35 countries including India and China abstained Russia's ambassador to the UN said the West is completely deaf to the problems of the global south and calls to finally address them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: All efforts are thrown at promoting the Ukrainian narrative, but not for the sake of the country's well-being, only in an attempt to harm Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Last month, Russia formally announced the annexation of four partially occupied provinces of eastern and southern Ukraine.

sentences.sentence: Voters in Donetsk, Luhansk, her son and Zaporizhia had according to Moscow overwhelmingly backed joining Russia but Kiev and its Western allies rejected the referendums as meaningless and illegal Ukraine's army claims to

sentences.sentence: A military spokesman said it had taken back five local settlements from Russian forces in the last 24 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, in the once-occupied eastern city of Izium, residents are having to queue for humanitarian aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Gas and running water are still cut off, several days after Russian troops were driven from the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We need food. We took bread because we have no bread.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We have no money to buy it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We try to prepare firewood, we warm the windows, we cover everything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I want to warm up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But for others, the only option is to leave. The city of Zaporizhia, the centre of one of the four regions annexed by Russia, has taken a pounding from Moscow's missiles recently.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, hundreds of lorry drivers are having to wait for ferries to cross into Crimea due to Saturday's blast, which caused the partial collapse of the bridge linking the occupied territory with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: While traffic for passenger cars and trains has resumed, freight transport is still disrupted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russia says it's detained eight people over what it's calling a terrorist attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Authorities in Russia have taken another step to control the country's internet and social network use.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Its financial monitoring agency has now added US giant Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp, to its list of terrorist and extremist organizations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In March, Moscow banned Western social networks saying they tolerated Russophobia. However, these sites are important sources for advertisement and sales in the country and people turn to VPNs to access them. It is now possible for the Kremlin to take increased legal action against users of these networks. The agency's decision to label Meta extremist puts the company in the same category as right-wing nationalist groups and Russian opposition groups, as well as foreign terrorist organisations, including the Taliban.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Energy ministers of the European Union have reached a general consensus to start joint gas purchases before summer 2023. At their meeting in Prague, EU Energy Commissioner Kadri Simpson said gas prices remain unstable and more measures to alleviate the crisis, including the need to further reduce gas consumption, were needed. Kadri Simpson, EU Energy Commissioner The Russian pipeline flows have dropped under 10% and attacks on EU's energy infrastructure increase the uncertain further.

sentences.sentence: This is why the Commission is working to present a package of proposals on the 18th of October, and it will not be the last such package, as we must continue to develop our tools and adjust our approach as the situation develops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Together with steep cuts in supplies from Russia, the 27-nation bloc is reeling from gas prices almost 90% higher than a year ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The strikes affect six of the country's seven refineries, two of which are owned by SOX and Mobil, while its rival Total Energies owns the other four. The CGT union says strikers of Total Energies have renewed their calls for a 10% pay rise in line with inflation and soaring energy bills, while left-leaning political parties have vowed to march on Sunday against the cost of living crisis. The blockade has resulted in huge queues and fuel shortages at several filling stations around the country, particularly in Paris. Some departments have also introduced pump rationing to a maximum of 30 euros of fuel per tank.
